title: N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 12 ยง 342.7 - Conduct of hearing
content:
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 12 ยง 342.7 - Conduct of hearing

State Regulations

The arbitration committee shall not be bound by common law
or statutory rules of evidence or by technical or formal rules of procedure, but may make such investigation or inquiry and conduct its hearing in such
manner as it deems proper and necessary in the premises. The arbitration
committee may, in the event of nonappearance, decide the value of the disputed
bill on the basis of the evidence before it. The majority decision of such a
committee shall be conclusive upon the parties as to the value of the services
rendered. Notes
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 12
ยง
342.7

State regulations are updated quarterly; we currently have two versions available. Below is a
comparison between our most recent version and the prior quarterly release. More comparison features will be added as we have more versions to compare. No prior version found.
